str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Peter, a Greek name meaning rock. Apparently a primary word; a rock; as a name, Petrus, an apostle.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Neuter of a presumed derivative of arguros; silvery, i.e. cash; specially, a silverling.

parse: Verb - Present Optative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
With. A primary preposition denoting union; with or together.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From nomos; properly, to do by law, i.e. To accustom; by extension, to deem or regard.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: (a) I acquire, win, get, purchase, buy, (b) I possess, win mastery over. A primary verb; to get, i.e. Acquire.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A (free) gift, a gift (without repayment). From doron; a gratuity.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
Money, riches, possessions. Something useful or needed, i.e. Wealth, price.
